title: Ranji Trophy 2024/25, where to watch live: TV channels and live streaming
description: The Ranji Trophy will begin on Friday, October 11. Here's how to watch all the action from India's premier first-class competition live.
author: Rahul Iyer
excerpt: The Ranji Trophy will begin on Friday, October 11. Here's how to watch all the action from India's premier first-class competition live.
text: The Ranji Trophy will begin on Friday, October 11. Here's how to watch all the action from India's premier first-class competition live. Ranji Trophy returns not long after the conclusion of the Duleep Trophy and Irani Cup. The first leg of India’s premier first-class domestic competition will commence on October 11. Champions Mumbai, who also won the Irani Cup last week, will begin their 42nd title defence with an away game against Baroda in Kotambi Stadium, Vadodara on Thursday. The second leg of the Ranji Trophy 2024/25 will get underway in January 2025, and the knockout phase will be played from February 8 to March 2. More: Ranji Trophy 2024/25 squads: Full list of teams announced so far This season will have several stars participating, with India players Shreyas Iyer, Ajinkya Rahane and Ishan Kishan all in action. The likes of Ruturaj Gaikwad, R Sai Kishore and Tilak Varma, who have impressed in domestic cricket and the IPL are also part of the squads for their respective teams. The Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy and Vijay Hazare Trophy, India's domestic T20 and List A competitions respectively, are scheduled between the two legs of the red-ball competition. Ranji Trophy 2024/25: When will the matches start? All matches are scheduled to start at 9:30am local time, which translates to 5am UK time. You can find the full schedule of the Ranji Trophy here. Ranji Trophy 2024/25: Where to watch live on TV channels and live streaming platforms Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in India Sports 18 will telecast the Ranji Trophy, while Jio Cinema will live stream the matches. Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in UK Details not yet available, will be updated as and when available. Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in Australia Details not yet available, will be updated as and when available. Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in the rest of the world Details not yet available, will be updated as and when available. Follow Wisden for all cricket updates, including live scores, match stats, quizzes and more. Stay up to date with the latest cricket news, player updates, team standings, match highlights, video analysis and live match odds. Series In Focus
html:
The Ranji Trophy will begin on Friday, October 11. Here's how to watch all the action from India's premier first-class competition live.

Ranji Trophy returns not long after the conclusion of the Duleep Trophy and Irani Cup. The first leg of India’s premier first-class domestic competition will commence on October 11.

Champions Mumbai, who also won the Irani Cup last week, will begin their 42nd title defence with an away game against Baroda in Kotambi Stadium, Vadodara on Thursday. The second leg of the Ranji Trophy 2024/25 will get underway in January 2025, and the knockout phase will be played from February 8 to March 2.

More: Ranji Trophy 2024/25 squads: Full list of teams announced so far

This season will have several stars participating, with India players Shreyas Iyer, Ajinkya Rahane and Ishan Kishan all in action. The likes of Ruturaj Gaikwad, R Sai Kishore and Tilak Varma, who have impressed in domestic cricket and the IPL are also part of the squads for their respective teams.

The Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy and Vijay Hazare Trophy, India's domestic T20 and List A competitions respectively, are scheduled between the two legs of the red-ball competition.

Ranji Trophy 2024/25: When will the matches start?

All matches are scheduled to start at 9:30am local time, which translates to 5am UK time.

You can find the full schedule of the Ranji Trophy here.

Ranji Trophy 2024/25: Where to watch live on TV channels and live streaming platforms

Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in India

Sports 18 will telecast the Ranji Trophy, while Jio Cinema will live stream the matches.

Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in UK

Details not yet available, will be updated as and when available.

Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in Australia

Details not yet available, will be updated as and when available.

Ranji Trophy: Where to watch in the rest of the world

Details not yet available, will be updated as and when available.
